result.execSummary:
The defendant Shonta T Redmond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
All costs, surcharges and assessment including the DNA surcharges to be paid by 5/18/2023 or to convert to a civil judgment.
-Court set restitution at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Time served disposition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shonta T Redmond

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shonta T Redmond in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Shonta T Redmond in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum previously received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with 30 days time served for a time served disposition.  
Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 5/18/2023 to convert to a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Shonta T Redmond not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense requests plea and sentencing date. Court orders matter adjourned back to Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save at 1735 W. Silver Spring Dr. Glendale, WI.

Defendant Shonta T Redmond in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Shonta T Redmond in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shonta T Redmond appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defendant is advised this case is re-assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37 due to co-defendant's lower pending case.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Defense requests to be heard on bail at the Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
